ai-patthana16.23:0.2_0: Having given the immaculateness of the Dhamma
ai-patthana16.23:0.3_0: Is looked on what is good and so on,
ai-patthana16.23:1.1_0: skilled in oneself and another’s mind.
ai-patthana16.23:2.1_0: Not for the sake of a skillful teaching, those who don’t give rise to the unskillful.
ai-patthana16.23:2.1_1: This is the section in brief.
ai-patthana16.23:3.1_0: the result of nine prominent speech ...
ai-patthana16.23:4.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
ai-patthana16.23:5.1_0: A skillful teaching doesn’t give rise to unskillful qualities. There are no cause or reason for them.
ai-patthana16.23:5.1_1: (But) the cause of practitioners, the overestimation of the fifteenth ...
ai-patthana16.23:5.1_3: that’s not the fifteenth day sabbath.
ai-patthana16.23:6.1_0: Not grasping the teaching doesn’t give rise to a cause, nor any bad, unskillful qualities that arise because of grasping.
ai-patthana16.23:6.1_1: Not grasping the teaching doesn’t give rise to a cause, nor any bad, unskillful qualities that arise because of grasping.
ai-patthana16.23:6.1_2: Not grasping attraction, repulsion, views, doubt, conceit, desire to be reborn, or ignorance. Those things don’t arise because of cause or reason.
